thread.title: Donald Trump Is Being Compared to Richard Nixon
thread.title_full: Donald Trump Is Being Compared to Richard Nixon

author: Kenneth T. Walsh
title: Donald Trump Is Being Compared to Richard Nixon
text:
Gabrielle Levy | Feb. 17, 2017 Senior-level employees were among some two dozen people reassigned at Foggy Bottom. Andrew Soergel | Feb. 17, 2017 U.S. News breaks down the week's most notable economic developments. Gabrielle Levy | Feb. 17, 2017 The former presidential candidate, who wasn’t a fan of building the wall, tweeted that ‘reality sets in’ for Trump’s plans. David Catanese | Feb. 17, 2017 The president says he’s still negotiating with the company for a new Air Force One. Lauren Camera | Feb. 17, 2017 President Donald Trump's embattled Cabinet head would like to see a diminished federal role in the education arena. The Conversation | Feb. 17, 2017 Soon, wearable fitness devices will be able to diagnose diseases. Could that lead insurers to deny coverage? Alan Neuhauser | Feb. 17, 2017 The Oklahoma attorney general has long opposed the Environmental Protection Agency and sued it more than a dozen times. Curt Mills | Feb. 17, 2017 The controversial Russian leader could be quietly worth more than Bill Gates, but how that wealth is calculated is controversial. Andrew Soergel | Feb. 17, 2017 Friday was a tough day for South Korean business leaders, as separate court proceedings impacted Hanjin and Samsung. Curt Mills | Feb. 17, 2017 White House press secretary Sean Spicer called the report ‘100 percent not true.’ Gabrielle Levy | Feb. 17, 2017 As founder of Crossroads Media, Dubke was at odds with Trump during the campaign. Paul D. Shinkman | Feb. 17, 2017 The search for Michael Flynn's replacement continues after an experienced former SEAL with lauded qualifications turned down the job offer. Joseph P. Williams | Feb. 17, 2017 The ad, from the liberal Constitutional Responsibility Project, is the latest salvo in the battle over the Supreme Court nominee. Curt Mills | Feb. 17, 2017 Malaysia says it needs DNA evidence proving the deceased is Kim Jong Nam, half brother of Kim Jong Un, or it won’t release the body or autopsy results. Alan Neuhauser | Feb. 17, 2017 Oklahoma Attorney General Scott Pruitt is expected to be confirmed Friday to lead the EPA, even though a state judge concluded that his office improperly withheld thousands of emails from public records requests. Paul D. Shinkman | Feb. 17, 2017 The intensity of the ISIS campaign has required the Pentagon to draw from its stores around the globe. Taylor Goebel | Feb. 16, 2017 Some businesses closed for the day so workers could take to the streets in solidarity. See More About Ken Walsh's Washington 
A longtime chief White House correspondent for U.S. News & World Report, Kenneth T. Walsh has covered six presidents beginning with Ronald Reagan. Along with other U.S. News writers, he continues to provide insight into the White House of Donald Trump and the world of presidential campaigns.
